tool.name: Rarefaction.shared
tool.description: Generate inter-sample rarefaction curves for OTUs
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='rarefaction.shared' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.rarefaction$:'$rarefaction --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --shared="$otu" #if $label.__str__ != "None" and len($label.__str__) > 0: --label='$label' #end if #if $groups.__str__ != "None" and len($groups.__str__) > 0: --groups="$groups" #end if #if $designc.use: --design="$designc.design" #if $designc.sets.__str__ != '': --sets='$designc.sets' #end if #end if #if int($iters.__str__) > 0: --iters="$iters" #end if "$jumble" #if $calc.__str__ != "None" and len($calc.__str__) > 0: --calc='$calc' #end if #if $subsample.use: #if $subsample.subsample.__str__ != '': --subsample="$subsample.subsample" #else --subsample=T #end if #if $subsample.subsampleiters.__str__ != '': --subsampleiters="$subsample.subsampleiters" #end if --datasetid='$logfile.id' --new_file_path='$__new_file_path__' --new_datasets='^\S+?\.ave-std\.((unique|[0-9.]*)(\..*?)+\.shared\.rarefaction)$:tabular' #end if

param.name: groups
param.label: groups - Groups to analyze
param.help: All groups will be analyzed by default if none are selected

param.name: use
param.label: run on a per set basis using a design file

param.name: design
param.label: design - assigns groups to sets
param.help: design has 2 columns: group(col 1) and grouping(col 2) (separated by a TAB character) use make.design

param.name: calc
param.label: calc - Calculators (Uses defaults if none selected)
param.option: sharedobserved - the number of sequences in two samples
sharednseqs - the number of sequences in two samples

param.name: subsample
param.label: subsample - size pergroup of the sample
param.help: Leave blank to use the size of your smallest group

param.name: subsampleiters
param.label: subsampleiters - Number of times to run the subsample

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The rarefaction.shared_ command generates inter-sample rarefaction curves using a re-sampling without replacement approach. The traditional way that ecologists use rarefaction is not to randomize the sampling order within a sample, rather between samples. For instance, if we wanted to know the number of OTUs in the human colon, we might sample from various sites within the colon, and sequence a bunch of 16S rRNA genes. By determining the number of OTUs in each sample and comparing the composition of those samples it is possible to determine how well you have sampled the biodiversity within the individual. For calc parameter choices see: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Calculators
.. _rarefaction.shared: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Rarefaction.shared
